intro: Vaccinium thysanocalyx, commonly known as the white-berry huckleberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of western North America, particularly in the Pacific Northwest. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. Its fruits are typically white or pale blue berries that ripen in late summer, attracting various wildlife species. This plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
